snippet: Since late November bread has been scarce, with a lack of fuel and flour shutting most bakeries in the Syrian city, creating problems for the new transitional council.
abstract: Shortages of fuel and flour have led to scarcity of bread in Aleppo, Syria, creating first test for Aleppo Transitional Revolutionary Council, sort of a city government in exile for liberated portions of Syrian city.

byline.contributor: Hania Mourtada contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon, and Sebnem Arsu from Kilis, Turkey.

lead_paragraph: Since late November bread has been scarce, with a lack of fuel and flour shutting most bakeries in the Syrian city, creating problems for the new transitional council.

headline.seo: Syrians Face a Bread Shortage in Aleppo and Elsewhere
headline.main: A Bread Shortage Is the First Big Test of a Transitional Council in Aleppo
headline.print_headline: A Bread Shortage Is the First Big Test of a Transitional Council in Aleppo

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
